page.title: 17THE RAILWAY
page.content:
A single track{railway}crosses the area.There were stations at Constable Burton and Finghall,but the former is now derelict and the latter has been converted into houses.
The line is no longer used for a passenger service except for occasional special trains,for example for Christmas shopping.The line is, however,still in use as a freight service,daily trains carrying rock from the quarry at Redmire.It is also used to carry coal to the depot at Leyburn.
Constable Burton was the more important station as it was the passing place and had a cabin and 28 levers.These have gone leaving only one signal and a derelict building to mark former glories.
